Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goose (only part of wing remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 36, no. 128, pl. 32)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 242, no. 234, pl. 18)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0230) (phase 2)
